name: Card 0
action: What does library architecture sound like? How could we rearrange the space to change the sound? Draw the sound or write a poem that describes the sound.

name: Card 1
action: Choose one type of aural architecture spatiality and write a description for that type as experienced in a library.

name: Card 2
action: Intensify the experience of the place. Listen to the materials. What mechanisms are in place for listening to your users? How might cultural [auditory] habits change how your library is used?

name: Card 3
action: Libraries have a reputation for being a “quiet” place. Create a map of an unquiet library. What kinds of information are elevated in the space?

name: Card 4
action: Test the silence boundaries of the library. After breaking the boundaries, refuse to return to silence.

name: Card 5
action: Draw the rhythm of the title of each of the first ten books you encounter. Listen to the cadence; the syllables, the way the words sound. Draw these sounds on an individual piece of paper for each book’s title.
